skill.name: clojure-write
skill.description: Guide Clojure and ClojureScript development using REPL-driven workflow, coding conventions, and best practices. Use when writing, developing, or refactoring Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Guide Clojure and ClojureScript development using REPL-driven workflow, coding conventions, and best...

security_audit.summary: No data theft, execution, or persistence behaviors are present. The file only contains guidance text for Clojure development and REPL workflow.

content.user_title: Improve Clojure code with REPL workflow
content.value_statement: Clojure work can be slow without a clear REPL loop. This skill gives concise steps and conventions to write and refine code safely.
actual_capabilities: Explain REPL driven development steps for Clojure and ClojureScript
Recommend clojure-mcp tools when available for evaluation and editing
Provide a bottom up development loop for namespaces and tests
Highlight readability checks after Clojure edits
limitations: No automatic code execution or REPL access is provided
Cannot verify -check-readable or run bin scripts itself
Guidance is focused on Clojure and ClojureScript only
Does not create tests unless prompted

use_cases.title: Refactor safely
use_cases.description: Follow REPL steps to break work into small functions and reduce regressions.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflow
use_cases.description: Share a common REPL driven loop and conventions across a Clojure team.

use_cases.title: Learn project habits
use_cases.description: Use concise guidance to follow expected development and evaluation practices.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new function
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a REPL first workflow to design a small Clojure helper function, then outline how to move it into a namespace.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor a namespace
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a bottom up loop to refactor a Clojure namespace, including REPL checks and when to add deftest cases.

prompt_templates.title: ClojureScript tweak
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain a REPL driven approach to update a ClojureScript function and confirm behavior step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced composition
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe how to compose small Clojure functions into a larger feature using REPL validation at each layer.

output_examples.input: How should I refactor a Clojure namespace safely?
output: Break the work into small functions
Evaluate the namespace in the REPL after each change
Validate each function with test inputs
Only compose functions after each layer works

best_practices: Work in small REPL verified steps
Run readability checks after Clojure edits
anti_patterns: Skipping REPL validation for new functions
Editing large blocks without testing each layer

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform agnostic and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only provides guidance and does not execute code or manage your REPL.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with clojure-mcp tools?
faq.answer: Yes. It prefers clojure-mcp tools when available for evaluation and editing.

faq.question: Does it access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The content is static guidance and does not read files or secrets.

faq.question: What if my REPL command fails?
faq.answer: Verify the namespace, dependencies, and working directory, then re run the REPL step.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic coding help?
faq.answer: It focuses on Clojure REPL workflow, conventions, and stepwise composition.
